text: Willem Johannes Witteveen (5 May 1952 - 17 July 2014) was a Dutch legal scholar, politician and political writer. He was a member of the Senate for the Labour Party from 1999 to 2007 and from 2013 until his death. == Early life and education == Witteveen was born in Rotterdam, South Holland. His father was Johan Witteveen. He was the great-grandson of social-democratic politician Floor Wibaut. He studied law at Leiden University. He was married and had two children. == Death == Witteveen and his family were on board the Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 when it was shot down on 17 July 2014, killing all people on board. He was 62. The flight was meant to go from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia but was shot down near Hrabove, Ukraine. Witteveen, his wife and daughter were among the 193 Dutch citizens killed. His son, Freek, was not on board. Witteveen was a Sufi. ==References== ==Other websites== * Bio at Parlement.com Category:1952 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Aviation deaths Category:Dutch academics Category:Dutch esotericists Category:Dutch jurists Category:Members of the Senate of the Netherlands Category:Labour Party (Netherlands) politicians Category:Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 Category:Dutch murder victims Category:Politicians from Rotterdam Category:Sufis Category:Writers from Rotterdam
title: Willem Witteveen
